title: Interesting architecture in a variety of styles
text: Definitely worth a visit to this palace with an interesting variety of styles from Medieval to Italian to Oriental. Massive rooms and lovely mosaics, art and sculpture throughout. The courtyard is beautiful with Italian marble statues.
place: Palace of the Grand Master of the Knights of Rhodes

title: Ancient Synagogue in Rhodes worth the visit
text: So glad we stopped to see this synagogue that is rarely used anymore. It was beautifully maintained and had some unusual things in it such as an olive wood 10 commandments on a column and a lyre of David on the back wall. It is a shame that there are only about 20 Jews left in Rhodes now. So glad they have preserved this synagogue. Gift shop was nice too.

title: Fun place to visit with family
text: We loved this place. it was so much fun while also teaching you something about science. Lots of illusions to try out and try to figure out. Gift shop is nice too. Glad we went....a little something different in an ancient city.

title: Beautiful place with an incredible history
text: We loved our drive up to this historic monastery. It is lovely and the people there were very friendly. It is interesting to see how worshipers place icons at the altar to ask for blessings or give thanks. The pebble mosaics that make up the floors are incredible.

title: Friendly, reliable service from airport to hotel
text: We used this service which was more affordable than others we saw online to get us from the Athens airport to our hotel. They contacted us ahead of time to check on flight info. The driver was on time waiting for us and safely got us to our hotel. Would use this service again.

title: A must see in Athens
text: This is something you must see when in Athens. We saw it both in the daytime and at night. The walk up is not easy, but we took our time and made it to the top. The history is unbelievable and the views spectacular. Seeing it at night was a special treat not to be missed.

title: Great Athens at Night Tour
text: Dem picked us up at our hotel and brought us on a wonderful tour of Athens at night. We visited the Temple of Zeus, the Olympic Stadium, and the Acropolis all lit up at night. There was plenty of time to take photos and he provided lots of information on each site. He also dropped us off at a great restaurant where we had dinner and he picked us up afterwards and brought us back to our hotel. We enjoyed it so much that we booked him the next day to take us on a day tour of Sounio and the Temple of Poseidon. Would highly recommend.

title: Nice hotel with great views in a central location in Athens
text: We stayed in an executive room here with a great view of the Acropolis. The room was clean and basic. The rooftop restaurant was great and our stay included a full breakfast buffet each morning with fresh juices, cheeses, breads and lots of other dishes. The staff was friendly. The location was great...convenient to everything.

title: Great place for a special meal
text: The Diamond Grill offers a wonderful atmosphere and delicious food. A great place to go for a leisurely meal for a special occasion. We recently had the filet and it was so tender, you did not need a steak knife to cut it. Great wines, great food, great service.

title: Worth seeing this famous landmark
text: We took a night tour of Athens and the stadium was included on the tour. It was definitely worth seeing and hearing about the history of this famous stadium.

title: Great way to learn about the history of the Jews in Greece
text: This is a lovely little museum, four levels of information about the Jews of Greece throughout history. The exhibits are well done and include lots of information about the Holocaust including a short film with stories by survivors. The exhibits could be a little more informative, but I think you can get a headset that provides more information than what is marked on the display cases. At the end of the tour are items from a synagogue no longer there - bima, ark, torahs and ner Tamid. There is also a small gift shop.

title: Great shopping with old Athens flare
text: We enjoyed shopping in the Plaka in the old part of Athens. Lots of souvenir shops and nicer shops. Shoes, clothes, accessories, t-shirts and lots of cafes. A nice way to spend a few hours while in Athens. It is near the Acropolis Museum.

title: A highlight of any trip to Athens
text: We did the climb up to the top of the Acropolis to see the Parthenon during the day and we also took a night tour of Athens where we saw it lit up at night. It is a must see when in Athens. We would also recommend a night tour - it is truly breathtaking. So much history.

title: Really fun place to visit in Athens
text: This was a great place to visit. There are lots of fun illusions to try and to be actively involved in. All are explained and it is very hands on. You can easily spend an hour or more in this small museum and it is fun and learning for all ages. The gift shop is great too,

title: Great frozen custard in a fun, retro atmosphere
text: This is a place where you go up to an outside window to order or drive through. They are known for their frozen custard and concretes (frozen custard with candy or fruit mixed in), but also have some food items like nachos and hot dogs. We love the custard. It is smooth and tasty and the portions are large. I just get the small chocolate custard plain. Delicious. We go here almost every time we are in Monroe.

title: Interesting menu, service not so great
text: We have eaten here several times. The food is good. In fact, their Caeser salad is one of the best I have ever had. The pizza is good with interesting ingredients and cooked in a brick oven. But the service leaves a lot to be desired.....slow and not very attentive. Also, every time we have been there, the air has not been working.

title: A hidden gem
text: Lovely museum in a former residence. Varied exhibits on a grand scale. Definitely worth a visit. Admission is free.

title: Wonderful museum filled with Jewish history
text: This museum located in the synagogue has lots of information about Jewish history, customs and celebrations. It contains a wealth of information about the Jews of Northeastern Louisiana and the early settlers and business owners in Monroe. Tours are by appointment.

title: Still classy and delicious
text: Since 1840, still a delicious, beautifully served, and classy dining experience. The drum almondine was amazing and order a baked Alaska ahead for dessert. Also, try the soufflé potatoes. And walk around the place and lost the memorabilia and block long wine cellar. The service is exceptional. Highly recommended!

title: Good food in the middle of nowhere
text: Found ourselves in Cameron Parish- a beautiful part of Louisiana to visit if you like nature. Not many places to eat, but we found T-boys and it didn’t disappoint. Good Cajun cooking..gumbo, seafood, great burgers and friendly and quick service. You order at the counter, but there are booths and tables where you can sit. And, the salad I had was very good as well. Rustic atmosphere- loved the light fixtures in upside down hanging buckets.

title: Not to be missed
text: This was a fabulous and exciting exhibit about the life and times of Alexander Hamilton. Very creatively put together with variety including interactive aspects and discovery. The exhibit thrusts you into the scene and you feel as if you are there learning about America’s history first hand. It will be in Chicago through January, 2020 and then will tour to other cities. Highly recommended.

title: Interesting menu, good food
text: This restaurant is near the Northwestern campus and serves fresh and delicious food. The menu is interesting- lots of comfort foods with a modern twist. Soups, salads, pizza, sandwiches. You can sit inside or out, weather permitting. The servers were friendly and the service was very good. I had the spinach and artichoke pizza which also had fresh tomatoes, mushrooms and goat cheese too. It was delicious and I took half of it home. The coconut ice cream was the perfect ending to a good meal.

title: Vast menu, great food
text: This is a true family restaurant from days gone by. Friendly wait staff, huge and varied menu - something for everyone- and huge portions. You will not go away hungry here. In fact, you will probably need a “to go” box. Most lunch and dinner selections come with a free cup of soup. I had the French onion and it was yummy with lots of cheese served in a brown crock. My husband had the matza ball soup which was also delicious. Every meal is served with a bread basket with a variety of breads and muffins. For the main course, I had the open face Reuben with coleslaw and 1000 island dressing and my husband had the chicken sandwich. Enormous portions at moderate prices. You could eat here every day of the year and never eat the same thing twice.

title: Conveniently located, nice place to stay
text: Nice place to stay, convenient location and friendly staff. We had an oceanview room and the view was lovely. We never went to the casino and did not try the buffet either - always a line. Instead, we ate at Stalla one night (Italian) and it was an excellent meal with great service. We also saw the Lunero show that was there and enjoyed it. The pool area is nice...wish there were more of a beach adjacent to the hotel. But the hotel is in a great location and there is lots around it. The rooms and common areas could use some updating, but we had a nice, relaxing time.

title: Delicious food, great service, generous portions
text: The atmosphere was lovely and the meal delicious. Service was excellent and quick and food presentation was beautiful. I had the chicken Marsala and it was perfect. My friend had the lamb chops- meaty and perfect as well. All meals served with warm, crusty bread with a mini dish of dipping sauces - olive oil, red pepper and hummus. Would highly recommend. Pricey, but worth it.

title: Disappointed- not like it used to be
text: We had been here before and were excited about going back, but the meal was not up to par. Service was excellent. The half shell salad with almonds and goat cheese was delicious. But the chargrilled oysters were overdone and not flavorful. The seafood platter was also overdone and the steak was ok. Probably won’t be back.
place: Half Shell Oyster House of Biloxi

title: Great view, great food
text: Delicious breakfast, fast service and great view. One of the best omelettes I’ve ever had-veggie omelette. The hash browns are really home fries and they were great.

title: Good food, fast, friendly service
text: We took a chance on this restaurant recommended by our hotel. The service was fast and friendly and the food was very good. Good Southern, Louisiana food. Plentiful portions. Would definitely recommend and we will return if we are in Ruston again.

title: Nice, clean place to stay with friendly staff
text: Another property in Ruston cancelled our reservation with no notice and we ended up staying here at the Fairfield. What a pleasant surprise. It was nicely updated, clean and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We ended up getting an upgrade. They even had a nice happy hour the evening we stayed with food and drink and fresh baked cookies. And the breakfast was great the next morning. We will definitely stay here again should we find ourselves in Ruston.

title: Great sandwiches...consistently good
text: We refer to this place as our neighborhood restaurant. Family owned, Critic’s Choice is always good. Their cheese steak is authentic and delicious. They also have a variety of other sandwiches, grinders and hoagies. Great appetizers- mozzarella sticks, fried mushrooms, etc. We love the cheese steak and the tuna grinder with their special oil dressing instead of mayo. You will leave very satisfied.

title: Best baked potatoes around
text: This is basically a drive-through restaurant - also has a walk-up window. They have sandwiches and salads, but the best thing on the menu are their baked potatoes. The potatoes are huge and always cooked perfectly and filled with plenty of whatever you order in them. They are very generous.

title: Authentic, delicious Italian food
text: The food at Verona has always been great, but the service very slow until this visit. This time, the food and service were outstanding! The portions are large and the food is authentic and flavorful. The menu has many choices, even a kid’s menu. We will definitely be back more often.

title: Good Italian food
text: This restaurant has a huge menu including pastas, pizza, and many other Italian favorites. The servings are plentiful and the service was very good. We had a large party and were served in a private room upstairs. Most entrees are served with soup or salad, bread, and pasta or vegetables.

title: Yum...don’t miss it
text: This tiny store front offers locally sourced, interesting flavors of ice cream and sorbet made fresh and frozen on the spot with liquid nitrogen. It is an amazing process which produces a delicious treat. Definitely worth the visit.

title: Would not recommend
text: I would never stay here again. The rooms are crowded and no nicer than a cheap motel....which is what it is. Any place that has bullet-proof glass at the check-in window is suspect. I put a towel down in the tub to stand on to take a shower and I would not dare let my bare feet touch the floor. And to top it off, there is an event venue directly behind the property with loud dance music blaring into the night. When I complained to the front desk, they said they were sorry, but there was nothing they could do. If you want to get a good night’s sleep and feel safe and clean, do not stay here. Totally not worth the price.

title: Hope you are hungry
text: We tried this restaurant for breakfast in a recent visit. Although the wait to get a table was longer than expected and a bit disorganized, the service and the food were good. The portions are huge and the presentation was nicer than expected. Omelette was delicious, hash browns could have been a little crisper and bacon less greasy. The biscuit (one of the biggest I have ever seen) was amazing! Great place for families. Good comfort food. A step above Cracker Barrel.

title: Delicious and plentiful Middle Eastern food
text: We drove 45 minutes to eat here and it was well worth the trip. The service is friendly and attentive and the food is superb. Everything was beautifully served and the portions were plentiful. The menu offers a wide selection of Middle Eastern cuisine. Hummus, moussaka, kibi, falafel, gyro, shawarma, etc. We will definitely be back.

title: Great service, freshly prepared food
text: Very small place, but the food is freshly prepared and very good. Omelette was delicious...also got the country potatoes and they were very tasty. Coffee was also great!

title: Best salad bar ever!
text: The pizza here is average with lots of choices. But the salad bar is amazing. Everything is extremely fresh and plentiful. Romaine and iceberg lettuce, spinach, cabbage, lots of veggies including peas, corn, beans, zucchini, etc. and delicious homemade dressings. One of the best salads I have ever made myself.

title: Great place for a yummy breakfast
text: They have 101 omelettes on the menu in addition to other breakfast and lunch staples. The omelettes are huge and fluffy and the homemade biscuits are delicious...dense and fluffy. They even serve them with honey! Yum!

title: Love this place. Visit everytime I am in Cincinnati.
text: This is an authentic bagel bakery with lots of bagel varieties and bialys. Love their sandwiches...the tuna is my favorite. I always stop by and take bagels back home with me every time I visit. They do a baker's dozen when you buy a dozen. Also, their other baked goods are great too.

title: Great Chicago deep dish pizza!
text: Had a terrific meal here. One of the best Caesar salads I have ever had -- they even had anchovies. And the Chicago deep dish pizza was awesome. Service was friendly and attentive.

title: Always get a good meal here
text: Mandarin is great for dine in or carry out. The service is always quick and friendly. The food is consistently good. Lots of variety of Chinese favorites and sushi. The atmosphere when dining in is really nice.

title: Great salads, tasty interesting pizza
text: Would highly recommend Dewey's. Their menu consists mainly of salads and pizza. The salads come in two sizes and they all have fresh and tasty ingredients. I ordered a small Greek salad that included kalamata olives, sun-dried tomatoes, roasted garlic, and cucumbers. And also ordered one of their specialty pizzas...the Edgar Allen Poe which had olive oil, roasted garlic, goat cheese, kalamata olives and fresh diced tomatoes and parsley on top. It was delicious and all was moderately priced. The service was also excellent.

title: Nothing like getting Graeter's at the source. Love their ice cream.
text: I love going to Graeter's every time I visit Cincinnati. Their various flavors of "chip" ice cream has large, smooth chunks of chocolate. I love the coconut chip, and mocha chip. A fun place to visit. They also have candy and bakery items.

title: Great service, Great BBQ
text: This restaurant just opened here. It was excellent BBQ -- the best in town. Menu is huge including salads (Rabbit Food); Bubbatizers, Sammiches, Baskets (w/1 side) and Plates (w/2 sides). Our server was outstanding checking often to see how we were. The food was excellent and plentiful. The brisket was the leanest I have had anywhere in town. They also feature a variety of specialty BBQ sauces on the table ranging from mild to hot. We will definitely be back and will carry out as well. So glad to have a BBQ place here that is good and doesn't include lots of grisly, fatty meat when they serve you.

title: Good Chinese Fast Food
text: It is nice to have a fast food restaurant in town where you can get healthier food than most offer. There is a nice variety of healthy items to choose from. The portions are large and it is enjoyable when you are in a hurry.

title: Fun place to visit especially with children
text: Fun excursion with children. They have lots of gators, even baby ones that you can hold. There are emus, pygmy goats, turtles and snakes. Cute photo opps around the park and a show where they feed the gators. There is a large gift shop and a restaurant.

title: Great seafood, plentiful portions at reasonable price
text: We always enjoy eating here. They have great seafood, famous Natchitoches meat pies and more. Lower prices than some of the other restaurants there. Service is great too!

title: Gorgeous Home, beautifully maintained
text: This home is a not miss on your stop in Natchez. It is gorgeous and beautifully maintained and run by the Pilgrimage Garden Club. You are not allowed to take photos inside the home, but the furnishings are magnificent and you get to tour both floors getting a great glimpse of what life would have been like pre-Civil War.

title: Large, informative visitors center
text: I was surprised at how large this visitors center was and how much information it contained. There was lots of information and even a traveling exhibit about the Underground Railroad. Also, a very nice gift shop. You can purchase tickets here for the homes in Natchez.

title: One of a kind home, must see on any visit to Natchez
text: This was our favorite home on the tour in Natchez. It is just so unusual and has such a story behind it. Don't miss it!

title: Delicious Bar-b-que! Worth a stop if you are anywhere near.
text: We love this place. Best brisket around! And the sides are yummy too! Fun place, definitely worth a stop.

title: Pretty Home, well done tour, free if you eat in the Castle Restaurant on the grounds
text: We enjoyed this tour. it is not as extensive as some of the other tours because this is a working B&B and you can only tour the first floor which is also open to guests of the B&B while they are there. Would love to go back and maybe stay here. The meal at the Castle was good, nothing great. Prices were excellent. And, the sweet potato muffins are delish.

title: Did not tour house because we did not have time to wait until next tour. Grounds are pretty and house looked nice.
text: We arrived at an off time and did not want to wait until the next tour. I was disappointed that what looked like a nice gift shop was closed because the person working in it was leading a tour. Wish someone else had been there to open the shop...we probably would have made a purchase. The house looked nice and well maintained from the outside. The columns are now painted a yellow-beige color to look like faux marble (instead of white). We walked around the grounds for a while because it was a nice day. Will have to go back to see the house.

title: Beautifully maintained synagogue is a hidden gem in Cochin
text: The Kadavum Bagam Synagogue is hidden behind a tropical fish store and owned by a private citizen who purchased the land in order to maintain the synagogue. We had a private tour with Babu (the owner). He owns the tropical fish and plant store that you must walk through in order to get to the synagogue. He has restored and maintained the synagogue beautifully and it was lovely to see. He deserves much praise for preserving this important part of history.

title: Well worth seeing on a trip to Kochi
text: This ancient Palace is well worth seeing to learn about the history of the people of Kochi and the Maharajas. The woodwork is magnificent and there are beautiful murals as well. It is located next to the Maharaja's Temple which is not open for touring. But, you can learn alot about the history of the area from touring the palace which has been converted to a museum.

title: Very interesting to see the Chinese fishing nets and fish market
text: Enjoyed learning about the Chinese fishing nets and seeing them in action and then strolling around the dock area looking at the fish for sale and other vendors.

title: Amazing site, not to be missed
text: This tour was so worthwhile. We took a ferry to this island with ancient caves containing a Shiva Temple. All carved out of a single rock, it is an amazing and massive site to behold. Definitely hire a guide to tell you all the details about the carvings. There are over 100 steps leading up to the cave. I paid approximately $32 to have 4 men carry me up and down in a Sudan chair. Definitely an experience! There are lots of booths along the way wear where you can purchase trinkets and souvenirs.

title: Purchased lots of gifts and custom clothing here
text: Chouhan waited on me and treated me like a queen. He was patient and caring. He helped me select lots of gift items...scarves, pillow covers, table runners. And I selected fabric to have several clothing items made which were delivered to my hotel that evening perfectly crafted. So happy with purchases I made. The fabrics are varied and beautiful.
